programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2003. As Rodney and Cassandra prepare for the arrival of their own little plonker, the Trotter brothers must raise the money they need to pay back the Inland Revenue or risk losing their cherished flat in Nelson Mandela House - but an old photo soon takes the plot into much darker territory. David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong and John Challis star in the last-ever episode

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters go on a lads day out to Margate with their mates, but things do not go as expected when their bus blows up, leaving them stranded overnight in the seaside town. Finding a room in the hotel from hell, the brothers are only too happy to go out and sample the local nightlife - and thats when Del-Boy gets a blast from the past. Feature-length Christmas special from 1989, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del buys a new manual to help him show Raquel more appreciation and give him the confidence to make positive decisions. Unfortunately, as a result of such upbeat thinking, the Trotters cash flow hits an all-time low and an angry punter is left baying for blood. The second part of the Christmas 1996 trilogy, starring David Jason, Tessa Peake-Jones and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses

Festive special from 1997, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Caroline Quentin and Leslie Ash

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: Ron Manager has a bewildering encounter with a female commentator, while the 13th Duke of Wybourne visits a farm, Channel 9 demonstrates the delights of English cooking and deaf stuntman Chip Cobb goes out in a blaze of glory

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: The Off-Roaders go white-water rafting and Channel 9 offer their version of fairy tale The Singing Tree. Comedy sketch show, featuring Paul Whitehouse and Charlie Higson

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans travel to Wales to spend Christmas with the Wests, but for Gavin and Stacey, parenthood continues to present them with several challenges, their baby now being 10. Smithy also continues to commit to his fatherly role, making the journey to Barry at weekends and every second Wednesday to see 12-year-old Neil the Baby. Nessa has adopted her own style of mothering, while Pam, Mick and Gwen have become the epitome of doting grandparents. On Christmas Eve, Dawn makes a shocking discovery about Pete that jeopardises their marriage - again - while a visit to the pub becomes an eye-opener in more ways than one. Festive edition from 2019. starring Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden and Ruth Jones

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: An audition gives Raquel the chance of a lifetime - and perhaps more importantly, an excuse to get out of Nelson Mandela House. Del-Boy is as excited as she is about the prospect, but only because he sees himself as the man behind her rapid rise to stardom. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del becomes a showbiz entrepreneur after discovering a sensational Tom Jones-style singer at a local club. Teaming him up with Raquel, he wastes no time in booking the duo at a birthday party for the elderly mother of a local hoodlum - but it soon becomes clear his new signing is not everything he is cracked up to be. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones, with a guest appearance by Philip Pope

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del is invited to a school reunion at the Nags Head organised by old adversary Roy Slater (Jim Broadbent), who has recently been released from prison and claims to have turned over a new leaf. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones

programme.sub-title: He Aint Heavy, Hes My Uncle

programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.desc: The Shipmans travel to Wales to spend Christmas with the Wests, but for Gavin and Stacey, parenthood continues to present them with several challenges, their baby now being 10. Smithy also continues to commit to his fatherly role, making the journey to Barry at weekends and every second Wednesday to see 12-year-old Neil the Baby. Nessa has adopted her own style of mothering, while Pam, Mick and Gwen have become the epitome of doting grandparents. On Christmas Eve, Dawn makes a shocking discovery about Pete that jeopardises their marriage - again - while a visit to the pub becomes an eye-opener in more ways than one. Festive edition from 2019. starring Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden and Ruth Jones

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Simon and Ray head to the nursing home to see Rose, while Sue and Esther mind Sues stall at the Craft Fayre together

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Simon goes on a bike ride with Larry while Esther spends the day with Sue, fielding questions about the wedding. Esther helps David get ready for his date

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Ray teaches David and Simon how to bowl, while Sue tries to plan for Christmas. Esthers conversation with Lyn leads to a drastic decision

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: It is 10 years since Geraldine Granger became the first female vicar of Dibley, and the villagers are keen to celebrate the anniversary with a party. The carol-writing competition produces some of the worst rhyming couplets ever committed to paper, the men decide a stripper would go down a treat and the unexpected arrival of a scantily clad supermodel only complicates proceedings. Festive special from 2004, guest starring Rachel Hunter

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jo and Mickey set up a sting at a crooked second hand store and get the shock of their lives when the villains ram raid the front door, determined to recover a camcorder. It transpires the camera contains film of gangster Craig Francess girlfriend in a compromising situation with another man, and the race is on to find the lovers before Craig does. A con-man makes a fool of Beth and Diane. Sam Kelly guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Disgraced detective Zain Nadir is interviewed about drug trafficking in Hayes End Prison, where he is serving 10 years for perverting the course of justice, and agrees to help his colleagues infiltrate the gang involved. Jack is not sure whether he can trust his mole and fears the worst when a riot breaks out just as the police move in to arrest the operations kingpin, Zains cellmate Jason Forbes, who makes good his escape in the confusion. TJ Ramini and Lloyd McGuire guest star

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Zain gets a frosty reception at the station when Heaton secures his release from prison to help with the recapture of escaped killer Jason Forbes, and Will cant help taking a swing at the man who callously disposed of Honey Harmans body in a bid to save his own skin. The pursuit leads to a gunpoint showdown, giving Zain a clear choice between escape and doing the right thing. TJ Ramini guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Former EastEnders actress Lucy Speed joins the cast as DC Stevie Moss, who brings a breath of fresh air to CID with her positive and lively outlook - though she manages to upset Mickey on her first day by stealing his parking space. Her first case involves a professional footballer who is forced to admit he is gay after his closet lover is run over in a hit-and-run incident involving his fiancee. Suspicion falls on the players manager Ernie Rosen, who also happens to be his prospective father-in-law and anxious to avoid the shame of a scandal in the family, but Sally uncovers evidence to suggest he is covering for someone even closer to home

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A student reports being attacked in the park on her way home from the bar where she works, but a history of false allegations casts doubt on her story until the Sun Hill watch realise they have a dangerous and increasingly reckless maniac on their hands. Kezia recognises a familiar face on the list of suspects but, in the absence of evidence, Sally agrees to go undercover to catch the culprit. David Sibley guest stars

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A boater jumps through a fireball after a gas explosion, a hunter has a heart attack, and fishermen get some much-needed advice

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A mother and her unborn baby are at risk, adventure biking in the Marlborough Sounds causes a nasty injury, and a Land SAR team saves the day

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A head-on crash leaves two men in a critical condition, crashing a dirt bike on a remote farm ends badly for a 12-year-old, and a tourist gets the ride of her life

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A motorcyclist suffers a horrible injury, a husband performs life-saving CPR, a concussed mountain biker is found dazed and confused, and police have some VIP passengers

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete meets a puppy who needs urgent treatment for a badly broken leg and a young Doberman who has spent most of her life in quarantine kennels

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: As the festive season approaches at Fitzpatrick Referrals, Professor Noel and his team treat three special patients. A one-year-old crossbreed puppy rescued by a charity from Romania is in need of complex surgery, with no guarantee of success. An eight-year-old Dalmatian needs work on its spinal cord, and a Labrador from Switzerland is having trouble walking. Noels investigations reveal problems with both shoulder and elbow, an unusual combination that requires dramatic intervention

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The fly-on-the-wall documentary focuses on everyday situations in the neonatal ward, which treats one in 10 of the babies born at the maternity hospital. Parents anxiously await news of their twins, who were born 17 weeks premature, and a couple remain positive that one of their newborn triplets will soon be able to join his two brothers at home

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A 19-year-old looks forward to becoming a mother after being told she might never get pregnant. Meanwhile, a woman who is terrified of needles dreads the prospect of undergoing an epidural, and a lesbian couple prepare for the birth of their second child

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: The Queensland Ambulance Service are on hand to help a young girl who calls after her grandfather falls. The ambulance is delayed after witnessing a car crash en route

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: The Queensland Ambulance Service are called to the scene of a horrific car crash. Paramedics Mat and Patia help a man who is anxious after taking drugs

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan is outraged when Ben, ever the romantic, buys her a vacuum cleaner for Christmas, so in a desperate attempt to make amends, he gets her a necklace instead. However, when he discovers it for sale at half the price the following day, he is determined to return it and buy it again at the bargain rate - but the no-nonsense jeweller (guest star Julian Clary) is having none of it. To make matters worse, Susan turns up and the Harpers end up getting trapped in the department store overnight. Meanwhile, Janey, Michael and Alfie decide to give Susan and Ben a thoughtful present for a change, but despite their best efforts, it does not turn out quite as planned. Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker star in the festive special from 2008

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are called to a 67-year-old with a lung condition who cant breathe. Plus, crews help a 53-year-old whos had several seizures

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Liverpool Womens Hospital opens its doors to 16-year-old Heidi, who is accompanied by her own mum Jo, and Adele, the mother of the babys father, who has decided to take her sons place in the delivery room. Dad-to-be Gavin hopes poetry will help his jittery wife Michelle get through giving birth to their second child, and 46-year-old Jane finds herself laughing through her daughter Louises contractions as a means of coping with the stress of being a birthing partner

programme.title: Tipping Point

The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary following Yorkshire Ambulance Services Hazardous Area Response Team. A man is crushed by his own car

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The Yorkshire Ambulance Services Hazardous Area Response Team tries to seal a major chemical spill and helps a teenager who fell down a chimney

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: Emergency services deal with the consequences of gun crime, racing to the scene when a man is shot outside a mosque

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The Hazardous Area Response Team is called to help defuse a bomb found in Wakefield, and to rescue a BMX rider who fell and fractured his spine in woods near Leeds

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A suspected acid attack on the streets of Bradford leads to a busy shift for the crew. Documentary following the work of Yorkshire Ambulance Services Hazardous Area Response Team

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Golden retriever poodle-cross Sukis front legs have developed abnormally and now require urgent attention as the bones of her forearms are growing at different rates, so Noel decides that major surgery is required. Beloved elderly Labrador Raffa is nearly 11 and has become lame with constant pain in his front legs, and Noel discovers cartilage erosion in both elbows. Meanwhile, five-year-old dachshund Zizi is rushed in after suddenly losing the use of her back legs overnight, and an urgent MRI scan confirms that Zizi has suffered an exploded disc

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A couple bring their 13-month-old cocker spaniel puppy in for scheduled surgery for hip dysplasia which will require two separate full hip replacements. Elsewhere, two-year-old cat Jazz is rushed in by mum Sarah suffering from a smashed femur and shattered thorax after being hit by a car, and eight-year-old dachshund Olive is treated after suddenly losing the use of her back legs

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete travels to Northern Ireland to pick up three stray dogs and bring them back to Essex. He also meets a Shar Pei who is in constant pain and may need surgery

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Chris and Tom go to the home of a woman having suicidal thoughts and demonstrate how well trained they are at dealing with mental illness, as well as physical injury

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Ash and Jamie rush to a lady with severe chest pains who is losing consciousness, while Chris and Joel help a man with low kidney functions who has been picked up by the police

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: A four-year-old girl has her droopy eyelid lifted, a rugby player gets his broken nose reset and a woman has an operation on her wrist after almost a year of agony

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Nick has an ultrasound taken from inside his body to find out if he needs open-heart surgery, and Irene has gel removed from her eye to make her see again

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: In a One Born Every Minute special, cameras follow four couples through their multiple pregnancies and births. Ana and Paul are thrilled at the prospect of becoming first-time parents to triplets, but receive worrying news at a routine scan, while Beth has to have emergency laser surgery in her womb after her babies are diagnosed with twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome. Carolyne and Gordon, already parents to four children, are shocked to discover they can expect three more, while Sophie and Carlos try to cope with the premature arrival of their two daughters

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Three couples who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood 12 months after they originally took part. A woman explains why it will not be easy for her partner to cope with looking after their child when she returns to work, and another couple voice their concerns about the effect that starting a family has had on their health. Meanwhile, Lucy seeks her husbands approval as she decides to resume her career as an opera singer

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: The Harpers gather to celebrate Christmas once more - although unlike previous festive specials, this one reveals how the family will be faring 30 years from now. Ben is in his eighties and still as grumpy as ever, thanks to a little moisturiser Susan has not aged a bit, Janey is tipping the scales at a whopping 20 stone and Michael is trying to hide his baldness with an unconvincing wig. While Susan is put out that grandson Kenzo, now 38, has not come to visit for Christmas, Ben is quick to point out that they have had some of the worst festive holidays ever, and this one looks no different with a greed gift exchange, a rival cousin and a nativity play battle. Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker star, with a guest appearance from Nathaniel Parker. Festive special from 2009

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are sent to help a woman whose foot was run over by a bin lorry, and a team is sent to assess a man suffering from an agonising headache that has been going on for days.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: At RAF Lakenheath, Michael Portillo discovers a slice of America dropped into the British countryside. In the market town of Brandon on the border between Norfolk and Suffolk, he visits Quorn Foods to find how a seemingly modern meat substitute emerged out of a post-war food crisis. Michael ends his journey in Cambridge, where he studied during the 1970s

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins a journey from the Midlands to the West Country, beginning in Derby, where he visits the citys famous 19th-century railway works. In Leicester he looks back to the early 1970s, when around 10,000 Asians arrived in the city after being expelled from Uganda by the dictator Idi Amin. He also hears how meat rationing during the Second World War led to the birth of Walkers crisps, still produced in the city

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos railway journey through the Midlands and West Country takes him to Coventry, where he recalls the destruction by the German Luftwaffe of the citys gothic cathedral in November 1940. He visits the factory of the London Electric Vehicle Company, manufacturers of the iconic London taxi, and then heads south to Royal Leamington Spa and the national centre for the Guide Dogs for the Blind

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Warwickshire, where he gets a glimpse of the work being done for the new HS2 railway infrastructure. In Stratford-upon-Avon he learns about the founding of the Royal Shakespeare Company, before a visit to Birmingham, where he recalls the redevelopment of the city centre during the 1960s and the arrival of black and Asian communities

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Skilled pickers Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz rummage through a collection of Ford and automobile industry items. Plus, Danielle examines the patent model of an unusual airplane

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike finds a Pittsburgh time capsule, while Frank gets stuck into six generations of stuff on one of Michigans oldest farms

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz check out rock band Aerosmiths original tour van, and Frank gets star-struck when he picks one of his teen idols

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien are in Wales, where they pick up and restore a dentists table and a barbers chair, and make a coffee table out of parquet flooring

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Max McMurdo travel the length of Britain seeking items to fix up, flog on and sell for profit. Max upcycles a brass propeller into a stylish table lamp, while Henry goes all Victorian with an old pond yacht

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletchers bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason. Originally broadcast in 1975

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Railway Collection
programme.desc: Steeplejack Fred Dibnah visits the Ffestiniog Railway in Gwynedd, Wales, where he talks about restoration work and is taken for a ride down the track by the manager Paul Lewin

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Railway Collection
programme.desc: The steeplejack and amateur historian visits Llangollen Railway, where he reminisces about the past, and is given a chance to fulfil a childhood dream with driver Robert Haslam

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Railway Collection
programme.desc: The steeplejack and amateur historian talks about his favourite railway lines, including the Bluebell in Sussex

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Railway Collection
programme.desc: Steeplejack and amateur historian Fred Dibnah explains what happens in railway works, visiting Boness and Kinneil, Scotland, and the Boston Lodge in Ffestiniog, Wales

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Railway Collection
programme.desc: The steeplejack and amateur historian visits the Midland Railway Centre in Derbyshire, where he is given a tour of the sheds and has a go on the hydraulic riveter

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Railway Collection
programme.desc: Steeplejack and amateur historian Fred Dibnah drives his own engine to Bridgnorth, Shropshire, to see an engine repair shed and purpose-built boiler shop

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: In the 100th episode, Derek heads to Northumberland to collect a rare 1975 NSU RO 80, Jack deals with a Mini Mayfair stuck in a barn, and an Aston Martin DBS husk is auctioned

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Disaster strikes when the Naughty Lass collides with a low bridge on the Bumble Hole Canal Branch damaging a chimney

programme.title: Guy Martin: Proper Jobs
programme.desc: The presenter gets to grips with nature as a wildlife warden on the remote Calf of Man island while trying his hand at birdwatching, rat catching, and cleaning up a beach for seals

programme.title: How Britain Worked
programme.desc: Engineering enthusiast Guy Martin and the team repair the water turbine needed to power an old saw mill in Wensleydale, North Yorkshire. He then ropes in a carpenter friend to help fell a tree and transport it to the building on a steam traction engine, before using the cut wood to make a replica of the first pedal-powered bicycle. Along the way, Guy learns about the lives of factory workers during the Industrial Revolution and how child apprentices were often little more than slave labour

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Dutch DAF 66 - in vivid daffodil yellow - lands at the North Yorkshire showroom

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Pauls on a big day out collecting a 1971 Jaguar E-Type and a 1933 Morgan three-wheeler Supersport, but first theres a flock of 300 chickens to negotiate before he can load up

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves in fast car heaven as he picks up a rare Subaru Impreza and an equally powerful Ford Escort RS Cosworth from North Wales

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1968 Honda N600 car emerges from a lock up in County Durham and Dereks in Scotland to collect an original RAC Bedford van

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Disaster strikes when the Naughty Lass collides with a low bridge on the Bumble Hole Canal Branch damaging a chimney

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops in Wolverhampton, where he finds out about the impact of Enoch Powells 1968 speech. He also visits Kingsford Country Park on the outskirts of Kidderminster, investigates pigeon-racing in Worcester, and eventually looks into Cheltenhams jazz festival

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire, Michael Portillo heads to the castle of Eastnor at the foot of the Malvern Hills. He also visits Coleford in the Forest of Dean, Slimbridge in Gloucestershire, and Bristol Temple Meads. From there he heads to Filton to investigate the centre of Britains post-war aviation industry

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys India
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley travels back to the country of her birth, travelling the length and breadth of India to explore its diverse landscapes and cultural traditions. In this episode, her epic journey begins in Tamil Nadu, where she witnesses religious ceremonies in glorious temples, before visiting Gangtok in Sikkim, the place where her mother lived as a child

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys India
programme.desc: Joanna meets the Maharaja of Dungarpur who shows her around his lakeside palace, and a Dalit community in Gujarat, considered to be Indias lowest caste. Braving the roads of Mumbai, Joanna takes a ride in the citys only all-female taxi company and visits the Times of India, where her uncle was editor of the paper in the 1930s and 40s. She then overcomes her fear of heights to explore the World One Tower, soon to be Mumbais tallest luxury residential building

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: Off the coast of Yorkshire Siwrengale is heading out for the beginning of the North Sea whelk season. Skipper Darren Warters is on the hunt with sons Regan and Lewis. But winter storms have badly damaged their pots - and miles of rope must be untangled before they can begin fishing in earnest. Reliance III is south east of Shetland, where skipper John Clarke is hunting for whiting, while Endeavour 5 is far off in the North Atlantic in search of squid - but when the prey proves elusive, the pressure starts to mount

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: The crew of the scalloper Golden Promise pushes Force 6 winds to reach newly opening scallops beds ahead of their rivals. With the boat first to the grounds, they are in for a big pay day - but only once they cover the £8,000 fuel expenses to get here. Family owned trawler Adenia hunts for 1,000 tons of mackerel to sell to the lucrative Asian sushi market, and skipper Ivan Toms and son Rhys fish Cornwalls inshore waters in Maxines Pride, one of the oldest trawlers in UK waters. Can they catch enough to give themselves a wage and put money aside for repairs?

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul collects a cherished 1924 Rover 9 thats been in the same family since the 1950s and only had one previous owner before that

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads north to pick up a 1954 Morgan +4 coupe in mint condition and believed to be just one of three still on the road

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek waxes lyrical about a pristine Jaguar XJ8 and a Ford Model T van tests his driving skills

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will go for the once-maligned Austin Maestro. The car they want to buy has already been sold but the seller has another - his own - on the driveway. Can they do a deal?

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the worlds deadliest scorpions

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Wildlife that inhabit the worlds grasslands, areas that are struck by some of the most dramatic seasonal changes seen in the world. The programme features footage of Brazils giant anteaters and Asian saiga antelope, as well as lions engaging in ferocious battles with buffalo in the flooded Okavango, bee-eaters taking advantage of elephants to help them catch insects, and caribou embarking on migrations across the freezing northern tundra, stalked every step of the way by predatory Arctic wolves

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wild animals that have made a home in cities, including leopards on the streets of Mumbai, peregrine falcons hunting among New Yorks skyscrapers, hyenas that live peacefully alongside the people of Harar, macaques in Jaipur, and langurs in Jodhpur, which are regarded as having great religious significance by the citizens. The programme also examines how some animals are struggling to survive in urban environments, and questions how cities can be built to serve their needs as well as those of the human inhabitants

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates what rising temperatures will mean for people and wildlife in the polar regions, and how changes there could affect the rest of the planet. He discovers polar bears in the Arctic are going hungry as the sea ice they hunt on disappears, and accompanies scientists studying waterfalls of meltwater in Greenland that are leading to a rise in global sea levels. From the Antarctic there are images of the break-up of the Wilkins Ice Shelf, which covered an area the size of Jamaica

programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: The last leg of Simons journey through South America takes him from Chiles Atacama Desert right down to Tierra Del Fuego, the most southerly inhabited place on Earth. In the Atacama, one of the driest places on the planet with is as little as 1mm of rain per year, Simon discovers shocking evidence of human pollution

programme.title: Robson Green: Worlds Most Amazing Walks
programme.desc: Robson Green walks a beautiful but lesser-known route in the Douro Valley in Northern Portugal, rich in ancient art, wildlife and world-famous wine

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will go for the once-maligned Austin Maestro. The car they want to buy has already been sold but the seller has another - his own - on the driveway. Can they do a deal?

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul and Jack head to Staffordshire to pick up five vehicles from collector Robs colossal barn, including a Mini and a Morris Minor

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave gets a nasty surprise when he opens the bonnet of a fast Ford from the 80s, and an Austin Heavy 12 nearly a century old sets off a bidding war at the auction

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James is joined by chef and restaurateur Mark Sargeant in Kent, where they cook on the regenerated Folkestone Harbour Arm they and visit a sourdough and beer suppliers located in a shipping container. Mark then takes James on a tour of his Rocksalt restaurant, where he samples the award-winning cuisine before returning to the harbour for one last recipe featuring Folkstone fish

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team look to the natural world for inspiration this time and create a wild and woolly garden thats perfect for a deserving young family in Middlesbrough. Despite having physical challenges of her own, young mum Phillipa supports other disabled families and individuals in the area, going above and beyond to make sure they have all the help they need. The garden features a mini-dinosaur kingdom play area, a natural-looking water feature and a vertical grow-your-own vegetable plot, and the team succeeds in transforming the familys modest suburban plot into a slice of the great outdoors with something for each of them

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh

Drama telling the true story of how a brilliant scientist and pioneering detective joined forces to create the most significant advance in modern criminal investigation. In 1984, Dr Alec Jeffreys (John Simm) unlocks a remarkable technique to read every persons unique DNA fingerprint, while a few miles away, DCS David Baker (David Threlfall) leads the search for the murderer of a local schoolgirl. Two years later, a second youngster is killed and a teenager confesses - but denies the first crime. programme.desc: A handsome new locum wins Maggies heart but soon falls out of favour with the locals when a misdiagnosis results in tragedy. Rural drama, starring Kazia Pelka and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: An idyllic summer day in Oxford is torn asunder when a parcel bomb claims the life of eminent mathematician Adam Capstone, a genius in the field of `Knot Theory". As Lewis and Hathaway investigate, they discover that, while the victims academic reputation was beyond reproach, his private life was far more dubious. It emerges Capstone was a man of carnal appetites, who had a string of affairs with young students, betraying his chemistry professor wife Elizabeth, providing her with a clear motive to do away with her cheating spouse. As the detectives work to identify the killer bomber, the case becomes a personal challenge for Lewis, who fears he may not be rewarded with another contract should he fail to impress Moody before his six-month trip to New Zealand. Detective drama, starring Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox, with Zoe Tapper, Tristam Summers and Oliver Lansley

programme.desc: Bear is distraught, while Robert is shaken and Nicola warns Kev off

programme.desc: Crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Familys Zoe Wanamaker) and four known killers are among those who meet Poirot at a bridge evening arranged by wealthy adventurer Shaitana, who sits out the first game - only to be found later stabbed through the heart. As nobody has left or entered the victims apartment during the night, the guests combine their skills to discover which of the party is responsible. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Lesley Manville and Alex Jennings

programme.desc: Jann reminisces about Christmases past - including the good, the bad and the humiliating - as it becomes clear there is more than one way to holiday. Canadian comedy series, starring singer-songwriter Jann Arden as a fictionalised version of herself

programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan is pushed hard by retired PR executive Jayne, who is looking to make a big return on several designer handbags to help pay for her daughter Charlottes fairy tale wedding. In Cheshires golden triangle, Kathy meets savvy watch collector Anthony who is looking to trade up his collection of luxury watches for one worth more than £100,000

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa is shocked and Martin suspicious by the unannounced return of her father. Ruth is helping Martin with his blood phobia when she discovers his predicament, and an unexpected caravan squatter thwarts Berts dreams of making a quick buck

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Boss James Constantinou and the team appraise more items brought along by members of the public. A divorcee from Newcastle wants to sell her £185,000 necklace to pay for her childrens private-school fees, a crystal-covered drum kit used on a Kylie Minogue tour catches the eye of staff member Patrick, and a widowed pensioner hopes to make a fortune from her precious rings. Plus, a valuation doesnt come easy to the experts when a client turns up with a 7ft Terminator model

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Following Jos assault, the team is devastated. While Sandy feels guilty for not protecting her more, Jimmy tries to keep everyone focused, but pressure mounts on him to re-arrest Malone. However, in the absence of evidence, Perez resists. Adding to his stress, DI Cole and DS Jackson from the MIT arrive and begin picking holes in his investigation. Stunned that a search of Malones farmhouse has not been carried out, Cole and Jackson conduct their own. However, when they arrive, Malone is nowhere to be seen

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Troubled by historical DNA evidence results, Jimmy has to face the fact that Duncan may have been involved in Lizzie Kilmuirs murder, and potentially Sally McColls as well. A shocked Duncan is brought to the station for questioning, hurt that Perez would even think him capable of murder. However, the detective knows Duncans lying - perhaps not about the murder, but about something else significant. So when Duncan finally admits he had an affair with Donna, its not long before a bombshell is dropped

programme.title: A Dog Named Christmas
programme.desc: A young man with learning difficulties and an affinity with animals tries to persuade his parents to join a scheme where abandoned dogs are adopted by caring families for the Christmas holidays. He soon has a Labrador in his care, and together they spread Christmas cheer in his rural community. Drama, starring Noel Fisher, Bruce Greenwood and Linda Emond

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass embarks on yet another new career, this time trying to earn a crust as a racehorse trainer after a suspicious death at a local stables leaves a window of opportunity. Meanwhile, former copper Blaketons well-honed instincts alert him to council corruption. Nostalgic rural drama, starring Bill Maynard, Derek Fowlds and Jason Durr

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bernie reveals a hidden talent, while Phil Bellamy is babysitting Maggie Boltons son Sam, but when he wakes up from a little nap to feed the baby, Sam has gone missing. Rural police drama set in the rustic backwater of Aidensfield, Yorkshire, starring Kazia Pelka and Peter Benson

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A criminals wife commits suicide, making Mike wish he had not been quite so forceful in extracting a confession. Meanwhile, Blaketon has the misfortune of getting mixed up in Greengrasss latest scheme to make a few bob. Rural drama, with Bill Maynard, Derek Fowlds and Michael Angelis

programme.title: Moonlight and Mistletoe
programme.desc: A businesswoman returns home to help out her Dads business Santaland after he suffers an injury. Despite her initial reluctance, she soon comes to appreciate the family trade. Drama, starring Candace Cameron Bure, Tom Arnold, Christopher Wiehl and Barbara Niven

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: Richard Abernethie is found dead shortly after disinheriting his sole heir and specifying that his legacy is to be divided equally among the remaining family members. Poirot is called in by his solicitor friend Gilbert Entwhistle, to ascertain whether the late Mr Abernethie met with foul play - and also finds time to investigate the murder of a beneficiary under the new terms of the will. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Robert Bathurst, Anna Calder-Marshall and Geraldine James

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa is shocked and Martin suspicious by the unannounced return of her father. Ruth is helping Martin with his blood phobia when she discovers his predicament, and an unexpected caravan squatter thwarts Berts dreams of making a quick buck

programme.title: Ed Finns America
programme.desc: History, Irish roots, Fenway Park and lobster rolls. Ed explores Boston’s culture, food and charm, discovering America’s friendliest big small town, one story at a time.

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs - India
programme.sub-title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Indian Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian and dog-lover presents his final report from Delhi, where 400,000 pooches live on the streets. Paul joins in with the celebrations for Diwali, the Hindu festival of light, with the people and animals of one of Delhis oldest dog shelters. He also helps a traumatised puppy make new friends, joins medics as they rush to rescue a four-week-old street pup who may have been hit by a car and falls in love with an elderly black labrador who lives at the rescue centre. Will he be able to resist bringing the pooch back to Britain with him?

programme.title: Inside MandS
programme.desc: Cameras are invited inside every corner of high street giant Marks and Spencer during its busiest time of year. In Bristol, staff prepare to open a brand new store and theres a behind-the-scenes look at the creation of this years experimental Christmas sandwich and the worlds first snowing chocolate box

programme.title: MandS: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host the grand final as the three remaining designers create their own full clothing collections and showcase their designs in a catwalk event. Cat Deeley and Bella Freud join as guest judges and one winner is chosen for their dream job as a fashion designer at high street giant MandS

programme.title: The Guards: Inside the K
programme.desc: Documentary providing unprecedented access to the garda of The K, Irelands busiest policing district which includes Blanchardstown, Finglas and Cabra

programme.title: Trigger Point
programme.desc: Alex contacts the police with critical information about a new attack planned for that day, but Commander Francis warns the team against placing too much trust in him - when the attack does come, its shocking in its ingenuity and deadly intent. When Alex calls again with more intelligence, the team must split resources to work out if an unscrupulous financier could be targeted next.

programme.title: Ana Kriegel: A Young Life Lost
programme.desc: In May 2018, Russian-Irish teenager Ana Kriegel was lured from her home and brutally killed in a derelict house in Lucan. The awful crime was all the more disturbing when her killers were revealed to be two 13-year-old boys - now the youngest convicted murderers in the history of the state. Here, senior journalists, barristers and family friends tell Anas story, looking at the circumstances around her murder, the extensive Garda investigation and the trial that followed. Featuring a series of new photographs released by Anas family, the documentary also examines the sentencing in this unprecedented case and explores the lasting impact of Anas death

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: As a doctor arrives to make a study of lung diseases at Wheal Leisure, Ross sets about forming an alliance with his fellow mine-owners to build their own smelting company and break Warleggans stranglehold on copper prices. However, Francis is deeply in debt to George - and what money he does have is being spent on lavish gifts for ambitious prostitute Margaret. Demelza resolves to lift Veritys spirits by reconciling her with her lost love Captain Blamey, and theres a new woman in Marks life - but she demands he finds her a home before they are married

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win the rolling jackpot, which starts at £3,000

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Mike Tomlin Show
programme.desc: Pittsburgh Steelers head coach Mike Tomlin offers insider insights, game previews and candid commentary

programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host the quiz in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants Ros, Joshua, Steve and Zara vie to find the single unbeatable answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: Signal problems lead to a restricted service during rush hour, which causes severe congestion at the station and the same equipment causes more grief 24 hours later - leading to the complete suspension of the line. Jonny and his team of engineers are replacing a 60ft section of rail as one of the clamps holding it in place has weakened, but they have just four hours to complete the complex task before the morning rush begins

programme.desc: Scott Mills, Gareth Malone, Louise Minchin and Glenn Hoddle must pit their wits against the Chaser, a ruthless quiz genius determined to stop them winning the cash prize. Hosted by Bradley Walsh

programme.desc: Brian, Pat and Connor take part in a shopping showdown in Leeds in the hope of winning a blind date with professional dancer Leah

programme.title: John and Lisas Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner celebrate the best of British ingredients, beginning with a delicious brunch of poached eggs, asparagus and hollandaise sauce, and a side dish of layered potatoes and onions with baked Tunworth cheese. John then makes steamed mussels with Cornish cider and bacon served alongside Lisas simple soda bread, and she creates a strawberry mousse cake for dessert

programme.title: The Mayfair Hotel Megabuild
programme.desc: Documentary following a major construction project at Claridges, revealing the engineering challenges involved in digging out a five-storey basement, adding four new floors to the top of the hotel and creating Londons most expensive penthouse. In the first edition, Donegal miners work 24 hours a day to tunnel under the hotel by hand, while hotel manager Eugene tries hard to ensure loyal guests like David Walliams, Christian Louboutin and Damien Hirst remain undisturbed by the work going on above and below them

programme.title: Love Island: All Stars
programme.desc: Maya Jama presents as previous contestants return to the villa in the hope of finding romance the second time around, with Iain Stirling narrating proceedings. Maya will be there from the start to give everyone a shoulder to cry on. Who will find love, who will turn heads, and who will be the winning couple?
